channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Europa League: Fans charged over violence at Leicester City match
item.description: Seven men are accused of affray after Leicester City and Napoli supporters clash before 2-2 draw.

item.title: Girl, 2, dies after falling from pony at Bedale Hunt meet
item.description: Bedale Hunt in North Yorkshire confirms the young girl died in a "tragic accident".

item.title: Red Bull in trademark dispute with English gin firm Bullards
item.description: The Austrian energy drink company is pursuing a legal challenge over the use of the word "bull".

item.title: Festival of Rescue sees firefighters showcase skills
item.description: More than 300 firefighters from around the UK demonstrate their expertise in a mass public exercise.

item.title: Boy, nine, killed in hit-and-run van crash in Keighley
item.description: The boy and another pedestrian were struck by a driver who then left the scene.

item.title: Town holds memorial service for victims of coronavirus
item.description: The organisers of the service in Bridgnorth said they hoped it would bring people closure.

item.title: Eye test on Leicestershire girl, 11, led to brain tumour discovery
item.description: Grace, from Great Glen, was diagnosed the day before she was due to start secondary school.

item.title: Large samurai scroll among 27,000 items to be catalogued
item.description: The Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery is cataloguing 27,000 items, including the samurai scroll.

item.title: Blessing Olusegun: Fight continues for answers over death
item.description: A vigil is held for Blessing Olusegun as campaigners retrace her steps a year after she died.

item.title: Oldham Athletic fans hold protest against club's owners
item.description: More than 500 fans of Oldham Athletic FC carried a mock coffin in a protest outside the stadium.

item.title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie: Sheffield welcomes home coming-of-age story
item.description: Jamie Campbell salutes Sheffield's role in the story of his extraordinary life.

item.title: How West Yorkshire influences the fashion world
item.description: From breathtaking moors to Yorkshire wit, an exhibition explores the county's impact on style.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Dorman Long tower to be demolished after losing listed status
item.description: Historic England's protection of the 1950s Redcar building was quashed by the culture secretary.

item.title: Abdirahim Mohamed: Fourth murder charge in Leicester stab probe
item.description: A total of six men have now been charged in connection with 18-year-old Abdirahim Mohamed's death.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Sheringham 125-year-old shipwreck revealed by calm weather
item.description: The sunken vessel is rarely seen due to ever-changing conditions at sea.

item.title: Digbeth scene hopes to see street art across Birmingham
item.description: The Digbeth street culture festival is back - with a dream to see artwork across Birmingham.

item.title: Education in prison: 'If I can do it, anyone can’
item.description: Two prisoners describe how their education inside took them on a different path.

item.title: Yorkshire Soapbox Race late postponement 'an utter shambles'
item.description: The race was due to take place in Huddersfield on Sunday but was called off on Friday night.

item.title: Cullercoats Watch House in urgent need of repair
item.description: Trustees of the Grade II-listed building are also seeking ways to bring it back into community use.

item.title: Derbyshire school friends MBE row ends in £21m shares ruling
item.description: Adrian Fewings was awarded an MBE for services to business and the community in 2018.

item.title: Buckinghamshire folly built on former brickworks to show its past
item.description: The work called Alfonso references the many Italians who came to the area to work in the brickworks.

item.title: Covid: Anger over Australian travel restrictions
item.description: Leanne Stokes has not been able to introduce her twin sons to family in Australia.

item.title: Mother of boy killed by dog in Cornwall 'truly sorry'
item.description: Frankie Macritchie asked his mum to leave the dog when she went to check on him, an inquest hears

item.title: T20 Blast final: Kent Spitfires beat Somerset to lift trophy for second time
item.description: Kent Spitfires beat Somerset to win the T20 for the second time - 14 years on from their first triumph at Edgbaston

item.title: Liverpool 3-0 Crystal Palace: Reds remain unbeaten as Sadio Mane scores 100th goal
item.description: Liverpool remain unbeaten in the Premier League this season after Sadio Mane scores his 100th goal for the club in a victory against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Fallon Sherrock becomes first woman to reach televised PDC final
item.description: Fallon Sherrock becomes the first woman to reach a televised PDC final, but loses to Michael van Gerwen at the Nordic Darts Masters.

item.title: Premiership: Leicester Tigers 34-19 Exeter Chiefs - Nic Dolly double helps impressive Tigers to win
item.description: Nic Dolly scores twice as Leicester stun Premiership runners-up Exeter 34-19 to begin the new season with an impressive win.

item.title: Wayne Rooney: Derby County boss has sympathy for club staff as administration looms
item.description: Derby County boss Wayne Rooney has sympathy for employees who may be made redundant when the club goes into administration.
